required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

lead_sponsor.agency: Sidney Kimmel Comprehensive Cancer Center at Johns Hopkins

collaborator.agency: Defense Health Programs with the U.S. Army Medical Research and Materiel Command

clinical_study.source: Sidney Kimmel Comprehensive Cancer Center at Johns Hopkins

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, observational study designed to contribute data from patients with symptomatic metastatic bone disease treated at Sibley Memorial Hospital and Johns Hopkins Medicine to an international registry hosted by the Swedish Regional Cancer Centrum in Stockholm, Sweden. This protocol supports a worldwide effort to collect and store information from patients treated for symptomatic bone metastases within the International Skeletal Metastasis Registry (ISMR)

detailed_description.textblock: The registry is designed to update a suite of clinical decision-support tools designed for use when treating patients with metastatic bone disease. The models estimate the likelihood of survival at 1, 3, 6, 12, 18, and 24 months post surgery, which in turn, may be used for surgical decision-making.

primary_outcome.description: OS (in months) calculated from the date of intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Reoperation or retreatment for any reason
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with reoperation or retreatment for any reason.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to reoperation or retreatment for any reason
secondary_outcome.description: Timing of reoperation calculated from the date of intervention.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients, age 22 or older
- Biopsy-proven or clinically-obvious metastatic bone disease
- Symptomatic bone lesion requiring intervention o Including, not limited to, radiotherapy, cryotherapy, radiofrequency ablation, operative fixation, prosthetic replacement, amputation, or any combination of the above.

overall_official.affiliation: Sidney Kimmel Comprehensive Cancer Center at Johns Hopkins

clinical_study.keyword: Biopsy-proven or clinically-obvious metastatic bone disease
